result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert L. Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert L. Johnson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 4:13 p.m. Defendant Robert L. Johnson in court.  Court questions defendant as to nonpayment - Defendant states he has child support and other court obligations to pay. Court explains that matter was adjourned for 3 months to enable defendant to make payments and defendant has made zero payments. Defendant wants to take care of today. States he can pay in full today. Adj. 4:17 pm

3:36 p.m. Defendant Robert L. Johnson in court appearing telephonically.  Defendant states he is having vehicle problems and can't get out of driveway. Just went back to work this week. Adj. 3:37 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for June 27, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
pd $100 to quash warrant per 2/23 NOTES - notified Mary at ONSO

Judge O'Melia will allow the warrant to be canceled upon receipt of $100.00.  Mr. Johnson currently in Vilas County Jail so they will have to be notified.  A review hearing will be set in March, 2016 to address future payments.
No appearance or payment of fine, court orders warrant

11:10 a.m. Defendant Robert L. Johnson in court with attorney Robert Elwood Hanson.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Michlig statement to agreement.  Hanson tenders no contest plea.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Schiek/Hanson/Court statement to sentencing.  Court imposes fine in amount of $579 (includes costs) - Defendant requests payment plan - Court grants $50 payment plan to start October 1, 2015.  Review hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

11:36 a.m. Defendant Robert L. Johnson in court with attorney Robert Elwood Hanson.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek statement - agreement reached/requests adj. in order for defendant to come up with restitution. Court statement-bond continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 11:00 am.

02:57 pm - Defendant Robert L. Johnson in court with attorney Robert Elwood Hanson.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea 
Bail continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 11:30 am.
May not be on any Shopko premises, SUBMIT TO BOOKING

02:13 pm - Defendant Robert L. Johnson in court.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will ,  Schiek statement to bail - Court sets $ sig bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 13, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
